data.name: reservationDurationLabel.Help
data.value: The minimum duration of a reservation.

data.name: daysAheadLabel.Help
data.value: The maximum number of days in advance users can schedule reservations. Minimum is 1. Maximum is 365.

data.name: eventsModuleLabel.Help
data.value: The module in which reservations will be created. The list displays the Module Title, so if you have more than one instance of the module, rename them accordingly to be able to identify them.

data.name: pageSizeLabel.Help
data.value: The maximim number of days, times of day, and reservation times to display horizontally.

data.name: timeOfDayDurationLabel.Help
data.value: Allows you to specify the time of day duration to be used when rendering the wizard (e.g. specify 120 minutes for 1:00pm to 3:00pm). Minimum is 60 minutes. Maximum is 480 minutes.

data.name: allowCategorySelectionLabel.Help
data.value: Select this option if you want end users to be able to specify the category associated with the reservation, or the resource to handle the reservation. You must configure the categories using the Edit Categories setting in the associated Calendar Module.

data.name: selectCategoryLastLabel.Help
data.value: Specify whether you want end users to select the category before or after selecting the reservation time.

data.name: bccListLabel.Help
data.value: The list of users that will get notified when reservations are scheduled, re-scheduled/modified, or cancelled. Either select from the list of registered users (if your site has less than 100 registered users) or type a valid username.

data.name: allowCancellationsLabel.Help
data.value: Specify whether you want to allow users to cancel previously scheduled reservations.

data.name: allowReschedulingLabel.Help
data.value: Specify whether you want to allow users to reschedule previously scheduled reservations.

data.name: displayCalendar.Help
data.value: Specify whether you want end users to select the day in calendar or list mode.

data.name: allowCrossCategoryConflictsLabel.Help
data.value: Select this option if you want to prevent users from scheduling a reservation at a time that has been already scheduled by another (or the same) user but under a different category.

data.name: allowDescription.Help
data.value: Use this option to enable or disable the Comments fields

data.name: displayTimeOfDay.Help
data.value: Specify whether to make users select a time of day before listing all the available reservation times. Useful when Reservation Duration is relatively small compared to the Working Hours.

data.name: cancellationFeeLabel.Help
data.value: Enter the amount to charge for cancelling a reservation. Must be less than or equal to the Reservation Fee, because it will be substracted from the amount to refund upon cancellation.

data.name: payPalAccountLabel.Help
data.value: PayPal Account to use for reservation fees.

data.name: payPalUrlLabel.Help
data.value: https://www.paypal.com (Test site that can be substituted for testing the interface: https://www.sandbox.paypal.com)

data.name: reschedulingFeeLabel.Help
data.value: Enter the amount to charge for rescheduling a reservation.

data.name: schedulingFeeLabel.Help
data.value: Enter the amount to charge for scheduling a reservation.

data.name: pendingPaymentExpirationLabel.Help
data.value: Specify the time to wait for Instant Payment Notification to arrive from PayPal. If the time expires and the user hasn't completed the payment, or the user navigated away from the PayPal without paying, the reservation slot will be made available for other users to schedule it.

data.name: moderateLabel.Help
data.value: Select whether you want to moderate reservations. If checked, you need to configure Moderation Settings in the associated Calendar Module, since moderation is performed through that module.

data.name: mailTemplateBodyLabel.Help
data.value:
Email Template Body (2000 characters max.) and Body Type.
Valid Tokens are:
{Recipient}, {StartDateTime}, {EndDateTime}, {DurationHours}, {DurationMinutes}, {DurationTotalHours}, {DurationTotalMinutes}, {Category}, {Name}, {Email}, {Phone}, {Description}.
Moderation tokens:
{Url}
Pending Refung tokens:
{Amount}
Note: Both {StartDateTime} and {EndDateTime} can have a format parameter in the following form: {StartDateTime|[format]}.
For more information regarding Date and Time Format Strings, please visit:
http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/az4se3k1.aspx

data.name: mailTemplateLabel.Help
data.value: Select the email template to edit from the list.

data.name: displayEndTimeLabel.Help
data.value: Specify whether to display the reservation end time when presenting the list of available reservations to the user.

data.name: moderationNotSupportedLabel.Text
data.value: Moderation is not supported via the selected Calendar Module.

data.name: remindersNotSupportedLabel.Text
data.value: Reminders are not supported via the selected Calendar Module.

data.name: sendRemindersLabel.Help
data.value:
Select this option if you want to send a reminder to the user scheduling the reservation.
  • Settings this option on will only affect newly scheduled reservations.
  • Settings this option off will disable reminders for reservations already scheduled.
  • For reminders to be sent on time, we recommend setting the "Scheduler Mode" setting under "Host Settings" to "Timer Method", and make sure IIS in not set to recycle/shut down the worker process of your DotNetNuke application.

data.name: sendRemindersWhenLabel.Help
data.value: Specify when to send the reminder.

data.name: iCalendarAttachmentFileNameLabel.Help
data.value: Enter the text you want to display as the Reservation Subject in the user's calendar when importing the attached iCalendar file. You can use the same tokens used in the Body.

data.name: itemDescriptionLabel.Help
data.value: Enter the description to display as the item being paid for. You can use the same tokens used in the Email Templates.

data.name: minTimeAheadLabel.Help
data.value: Specify the minimum time ahead for scheduling reservations. If set to one hour, users will be able to schedule reservations starting one hour from the current time, giving you time to prepare for the reservation.

data.name: themeLabel.Help
data.value: Select a theme to apply to the module. You can create your own themes by adding a folder [ThemeName] to the Themes directory and adding a [ThemeName].css file to it.

data.name: moderationListSettingsAllowUsersToSortLabel.Help
data.value: Controls whether to allow users to sort by clicking column headers.

data.name: moderationListSettingsDisplayColumnLabel.Help
data.value: Use the visible checkboxes to switch display of columns on and off. You can set the display order of columns using the up and down arrows.

data.name: moderationListSettingsMaxTextLengthLabel.Help
data.value: Text longer that this value in length will be cut off and ... will be appended.

data.name: moderationListSettingsPagerModeLabel.Help
data.value: Specifies whether the pager element displays buttons that link to the next and previous page, or numeric buttons that link directly to a page.

data.name: moderationListSettingsPageSizeLabel.Help
data.value: Controls the page size when paging is enabled.

data.name: moderationListSettingsSortColumnLabel.Help
data.value: Add/remove sort columns to the list to sort the reservations list by the selected columns.

data.name: globalModeratorListLabel.Help
data.value: Specify the list of users you want to be give Moderator access to. Moderators will be sent email notifications to when a reservation is scheduled and awaiting approval. Either select from the list of registered users (if your site has less than 100 registered users) or type a valid username.

data.name: categoryLabel.Help
data.value: You can specify the Resource or Category for which you want to configure the settings below by using the Resource/Category list. Select <All> to configure the settings for all Resources or Categories. Configuring settings for a specific Resource or Category will override the <All> settings.

data.name: ExceptionsSettings.Help
data.value: In this section you can set working hours for specific days. Entries here will override those under the Working Hours - Recurrent section if they fall on the same date, and will add working hours to days not under Working Hours - Recurrent.

data.name: redirectUrlLabel.Help
data.value: Enter the URL to redirect users to when they are done scheduling the reservation (click Done button).

data.name: requirePhoneLabel.Help
data.value: Specify whether you want the Phone field to be required or optional.

data.name: maxConflictingReservationsLabel.Help
data.value: Enter the maximum number of reservations at a time that you will be accepting. Minimum is 1, meaning that no conflicts are to be allowed. Note: If you enable Resource/Category selection and Prevent Cross-Category Conflicts, this setting applies to [All Categories] only and will limit the number for conflicting reservations regardless of the category selected.

data.name: currencyLabel.Help
data.value: The currency used for reservation fees.

data.name: TimeOfDayListError.Text
data.value: Time of Day List must add up to 24 hours.

data.name: reservationDurationMaxLabel.Help
data.value: The maximum duration of a reservation.

data.name: reservationIntervalLabel.Help
data.value: The start time increment interval for reservations. Maximum is 24 hours.

data.name: displayUnavailableTimeOfDay.Help
data.value: Check this box if you would like to display unavailable times of day. Users will not be able to click on them.

data.name: categoryPermissionsLabel.Help
data.value: Specify the roles to be allowed to schedule reservations for the selected category,

data.name: categorySelectionModeLabel.Help
data.value: Specify whether you want end users to select the category from a horizontal list, a drop down list, or a list box. Horizontal list requires jQuery 1.7 or higher.

data.name: allowPayLaterLabel.Help
data.value: Select this option if you want to allow users to schedule/reschedule reservations without paying upfront.

data.name: cashierListLabel.Help
data.value: Specify the list of users you want to be give Cashier access to. Cashiers will be sent email notifications to when a reservation is rescheduled or cancelled and is awaiting a refund. In addition, Cashiers have access to the Cashier screen, where they can manage payments and refunds. Either select from the list of registered users (if your site has less than 100 registered users) or type a valid username.

data.name: requireVerificationCodeLabel.Help
data.value: Select this option if you want to issue a verification code upon scheduling a reservation. This code will be sent to the user scheduling the reservation and will be required for viewing/editing reservations. Verification Codes are random and unique for each email address.

data.name: allowLookupByPhoneLabel.Help
data.value: Allow to View/Edit a Reservation by Phone in addition to Email.

data.name: reservationDurationIntervalLabel.Help
data.value: The interval by which to increase duration selection. Only applicable when Min. Reservation Duration and Max. Reservation Duration are different.

data.name: requireEmailLabel.Help
data.value: Specify whether you want the Email field to be required or optional. If unchecked, "Require Verification Code" will de disabled. Consider requiring either Email or Phone to allow Viewing/Editing Reservations.

data.name: displayRemainingReservationsLabel.Help
data.value: Check this box if you want to display the number of remaining reservations next to the Category (if enabled) and Time of Day (if enabled.)

data.name: displayUnavailableCategoriesLabel.Help
data.value: Check this box if you would like to display unavailable categories. Users will not be able to click on them.

data.name: allowSchedulingAnotherReservationLabel.Help
data.value: Select whether to display a button on the confirmation page to schedule another reservation using the contact information of the scheduled reservation.

data.name: duplicateReservationsListLabel.Help
data.value: The list of users that will have access to the Duplicate Reservations Report. Either select from the list of registered users (if your site has less than 100 registered users) or type a valid username.

data.name: allowEmergencyRequestLabel.Help
data.value: Select this option if you want to give users the option to fill out an form that will send an email to the notification list when there are no reservations available within the time frame required by the user.

data.name: bindUponSelectionLabel.Help
data.value: Select this option to have the module load the open time slots after the user selects the category. Selecting this will improve performance.

data.name: requireConfirmationLabel.Help
data.value: Select this feature if you want to have users confirm their reservation. If the reservation is not confirmed within the time frame specified below, the reservation will be automatically cancelled by the system. *Does not apply to paid reservations*

data.name: requireConfirmationWhenLabel.Help
data.value: Specify when should the reservation be cancelled if the user does not confirm it by clicking on the confirmation link included in the reminder email. This value must be less than the Send Reminder When value by a considerable amount, so users have time to confirm after they receive the reminder email.

data.name: requireConfirmationInstructionsLabel.Text
data.value:
• You need to modify the Reservation Reminder template(s) to include the instructions on how to confirm the reservation. Instructions should read:
    • You need to confirm your reservation within [X] days or it will be automatically cancelled by the system. To confirm your reservation, please navigate to [type module's URL here], select View/Edit Reservation and follow the on-screen instructions.

data.name: allowEmergencyRequestsLabel.Help
data.value: Select this option if you would like users to be able to submit a reservation request form when the next available reservation is not in the time-frame required by the user, or there is no next available reservation. Once submitted, an email is sent to the person assigned to the category for their attention.

data.name: viewReservationsListLabel.Help
data.value: The list of users that will have access to the Reservations Report. Either select from the list of registered users (if your site has less than 100 registered users) or type a valid username.

data.name: moderationHoursHelp.Text
data.value: Specify the days and hours to moderate by adding them to the list below. By default, reservations are moderated at all times.

data.name: contactInfoFirstLabel.Help
data.value: Specify whether to collect the contact information before or after collecting the reservation time.

data.name: timeOfDaySelectionModeLabel.Help
data.value: Specify whether you want end users to select the time of day from a horizontal list, a drop down list, or a list box. Horizontal list requires jQuery 1.7 or higher.

data.name: timeSelectionModeLabel.Help
data.value: Specify whether you want end users to select the time from a horizontal list, a drop down list, or a list box. Horizontal list requires jQuery 1.7 or higher.

data.name: durationSelectionModeLabel.Help
data.value: Specify whether you want end users to select the duration from a horizontal list, a drop down list, or a list box. Horizontal list requires jQuery 1.7 or higher.

data.name: mailFromLabel.Help
data.value: Specify the address to use as the sender for all email notifications.

data.name: bodyTypeLabel.Help
data.value: Specify whether the body of the email is in HTML or text format.

data.name: categoryListLabel.Help
data.value: Enter the list of resources/categories to use.

data.name: ConfirmDelete.Text
data.value: Are you sure you want to delete this item? This action cannot be undone.

data.name: timeZoneLabel.Help
data.value: Select the time zone where reservations will take place. This setting is of particular importance if your clients are located on different time zones.

data.name: attachICalendarLabel.Help
data.value: Select this option to attach an ICALENDAR file on email notifications, allowing users to import into their calendar application of choice.

data.name: maxReservationsPerUserLabel.Help
data.value: Specify the max. number of reservations per user (email address). Leave blank for unlimited.

data.name: skipContactInfoLabel.Help
data.value: Select this option to skip the contact info screen for authenticated users.

data.name: skipContactInfoLabel.Text
data.value: Skip Contact Info for Logged In Users:

data.name: sendRemindersViaLabel.Help
data.value: Select the method(s) of sending reservation reminders. If you select SMS, you must configure your SMS settings in the SMS Settings & Templates section below.

data.name: smsTemplateBodyLabel.Help
data.value:
SMS Template (2000 characters max.)
Valid Tokens are:
{Recipient}, {StartDateTime}, {EndDateTime}, {DurationHours}, {DurationMinutes}, {DurationTotalHours}, {DurationTotalMinutes}, {Category}, {Name}, {Email}, {Phone}, {Description}.
Note: Both {StartDateTime} and {EndDateTime} can have a format parameter in the following form: {StartDateTime|[format]}.
For more information regarding Date and Time Format Strings, please visit:
http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/az4se3k1.aspx

data.name: smsTemplateLabel.Help
data.value: Select the SMS template to edit from the list.

data.name: twilioAccountSIDLabel.Help
data.value: Enter the Account SID of your Twilio account.

data.name: twilioAuthTokenLabel.Help
data.value: Enter the Auth Token of your Twilio account.

data.name: twilioFromLabel.Help
data.value: Enter the Twilio phone number to use as the sender of the SMS.

data.name: noFeeScheduleLabel.Text
data.value: No fee schedule configured. Reservations are free.

data.name: authorizeNetApiLoginLabel.Help
data.value: Authorize.Net API Login ID. Refer to http://www.authorize.net/support/SIM_guide.pdf for more information

data.name: authorizeNetMerchantHashLabel.Help
data.value: Authorize.Net MD5-Hash. Must match your Authorize.Net entry, otherwise, payments will get processed but reservations will not get posted. Refer to http://www.authorize.net/support/SIM_guide.pdf for more information

data.name: authorizeNetTestModeLabel.Help
data.value: Select this option if you want to use an Authorize.Net developer/sandbox account to test transactions. If enabled, the above settings (API Login, Transaction Key, and MD5-Hash) must belong to your sandbox account. You can sign-up or sign-in to you sanbox account at https://sandbox.authorize.net

data.name: authorizeNetTransactionKeyLabel.Help
data.value: Authorize.Net Transaction Key. Refer to http://www.authorize.net/support/SIM_guide.pdf for more information

data.name: paymentMethodLabel.Help
data.value: Select the payment processor/method to use. For Authorize.Net, make sure to customize your hosted payment page (Payment Form) and set your MD5-Hash accordingly (Refer to http://www.authorize.net/support/SIM_guide.pdf for more information)
